   18: %% %CopyrightEnd%
   19: %%
   20: %% Originally based on Per Gustafsson's test suite.
   21: %%
   22: 
   23: -module(bs_bincomp_r25_SUITE).
   24: 
   25: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   26: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   27:          verify_highest_opcode/1,
   28: 	 byte_aligned/1,bit_aligned/1,extended_byte_aligned/1,
   29: 	 extended_bit_aligned/1,mixed/1,filters/1,trim_coverage/1,
   30: 	 nomatch/1,sizes/1,general_expressions/1,
   31:          no_generator/1,zero_pattern/1,multiple_segments/1,
   32:          grab_bag/1]).
   33: 
   34: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   35: 
   36: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   37: 
   38: all() ->
   39:     [verify_highest_opcode,
   40:      byte_aligned, bit_aligned, extended_byte_aligned,
   41:      extended_bit_aligned, mixed, filters, trim_coverage,
   42:      nomatch, sizes, general_expressions,
   43:      no_generator, zero_pattern, multiple_segments,
   44:      grab_bag].
   45: 
   46: groups() ->
   47:     [].
   48: 
   49: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   50:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   51:     Config.
   52: 
   53: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   54:     ok.
   55: 
   56: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   57: 	Config.
   58: 
   59: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   60: 	Config.
   61: 
   62: verify_highest_opcode(_Config) ->
   63:     case ?MODULE of
   64:         bs_construct_r24_SUITE ->
   65:             {ok,Beam} = file:read_file(code:which(?MODULE)),
   66:             case test_lib:highest_opcode(Beam) of
   67:                 Highest when Highest =< 176 ->
   68:                     ok;
   69:                 TooHigh ->
   70:                     ct:fail({too_high_opcode,TooHigh})
   71:             end;
   72:         bs_construct_r25_SUITE ->
   73:             {ok,Beam} = file:read_file(code:which(?MODULE)),
   74:             case test_lib:highest_opcode(Beam) of
   75:                 Highest when Highest =< 180 ->
   76:                     ok;
   77:                 TooHigh ->
   78:                     ct:fail({too_high_opcode,TooHigh})
   79:             end;
   80:         _ ->
   81:             ok
   82:     end.
   83: 
   84: byte_aligned(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   85:     cs_init(),
   86:     <<"abcdefg">> = cs(<< <<(X+32)>> || <<X>> <= <<"ABCDEFG">> >>),
   87:     <<"AxyzBxyzCxyz">> = cs(<< <<X, "xyz">> || <<X>> <= <<"ABC">> >>),
   88:     <<1:32/little,2:32/little,3:32/little,4:32/little>> =
   89: 	cs(<< <<X:32/little>> || <<X:32>> <= <<1:32,2:32,3:32,4:32>> >>),
   90:     cs(<<1:32/little,2:32/little,3:32/little,4:32/little>> =
   91: 	   << <<X:32/little>> || <<X:16>> <= <<1:16,2:16,3:16,4:16>> >>),
   92:     cs_end().
   93: 
   94: bit_aligned(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   95:     cs_init(),
   96:     <<$a:7,$b:7,$c:7,$d:7,$e:7,$f:7,$g:7>> =
   97: 	cs(<< <<(X+32):7>> || <<X>> <= <<"ABCDEFG">> >>),
   98:     <<"ABCDEFG">> = cs(<< <<(X-32)>> || <<X:7>> <= id(<<$a:7,$b:7,$c:7,$d:7,$e:7,$f:7,$g:7>>) >>),
   99:     <<1:31/little,2:31/little,3:31/little,4:31/little>> =
  100: 	cs(<< <<X:31/little>> || <<X:31>> <= <<1:31,2:31,3:31,4:31>> >>),
  101:     <<1:31/little,2:31/little,3:31/little,4:31/little>> =
  102: 	cs(<< <<X:31/little>> || <<X:15>> <= <<1:15,2:15,3:15,4:15>> >>),
  103:     cs_end().
  104: 
  105: extended_byte_aligned(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  106:     cs_init(),
  107:     <<"abcdefg">> = cs(<< <<(X+32)>> || X <- "ABCDEFG" >>),
  108:     "abcdefg" = [(X+32) || <<X>> <= <<"ABCDEFG">>],
  109:     <<1:32/little,2:32/little,3:32/little,4:32/little>> =
  110: 	cs(<< <<X:32/little>> || X <- [1,2,3,4] >>),
  111:     [256,512,768,1024] =
  112: 	[X || <<X:16/little>> <= <<1:16,2:16,3:16,4:16>>],
  113:     cs_end().
  114: 
  115: extended_bit_aligned(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  116:     cs_init(),
  117:     <<$a:7,$b:7,$c:7,$d:7,$e:7,$f:7,$g:7>> =
  118: 	cs(<< <<(X+32):7>> || X <- "ABCDEFG" >>),
  119:     "ABCDEFG" = [(X-32) || <<X:7>> <= <<$a:7,$b:7,$c:7,$d:7,$e:7,$f:7,$g:7>>],
  120:     <<1:31/little,2:31/little,3:31/little,4:31/little>> =
  121: 	cs(<< <<X:31/little>> || X <- [1,2,3,4] >>),
  122:     [256,512,768,1024] =
  123: 	[X || <<X:15/little>> <= <<1:15,2:15,3:15,4:15>>],
  124:     cs_end().
  125: 
  126: mixed(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  127:     cs_init(),
  128:     <<2,3,3,4,4,5,5,6>> =
  129: 	cs(<< <<(X+Y)>> || <<X>> <= <<1,2,3,4>>, <<Y>> <= <<1,2>> >>),
  130:     <<2,3,3,4,4,5,5,6>> =
  131: 	cs(<< <<(X+Y)>> || <<X>> <= <<1,2,3,4>>, Y <- [1,2] >>),
  132:     <<2,3,3,4,4,5,5,6>> =
  133: 	cs(<< <<(X+Y)>> || X <- [1,2,3,4], Y <- [1,2] >>),
  134:     One = id([1,2,3,4]),
  135:     Two = id([1,2]),
  136:     <<2,3,3,4,4,5,5,6>> =
  137: 	cs(<< <<(X+Y)>> || X <- One, Y <- Two >>),
  138:     [2,3,3,4,4,5,5,6] =
  139: 	[(X+Y) || <<X>> <= <<1,2,3,4>>, <<Y>> <= <<1,2>>],
  140:     [2,3,3,4,4,5,5,6] =
  141: 	[(X+Y) || <<X>> <= <<1,2,3,4>>, Y <- [1,2]],
  142:     <<2:3,3:3,3:3,4:3,4:3,5:3,5:3,6:3>> =
  143: 	cs(<< <<(X+Y):3>> || <<X:3>> <= <<1:3,2:3,3:3,4:3>>,
  144:                               <<Y:3>> <= <<1:3,2:3>> >>),
  145:     <<2:3,3:3,3:3,4:3,4:3,5:3,5:3,6:3>> =
  146: 	cs(<< <<(X+Y):3>> || <<X:3>> <= <<1:3,2:3,3:3,4:3>>, Y <- [1,2] >>),
  147:     <<2:3,3:3,3:3,4:3,4:3,5:3,5:3,6:3>> =
  148: 	cs(<< <<(X+Y):3>> || X <- [1,2,3,4], Y <- [1,2] >>),
  149:     <<2:3,3:3,3:3,4:3,4:3,5:3,5:3,6:3>> =
  150: 	cs_default(<< <<(X+Y):3>> || {X,Y} <- [{1,1},{1,2},{2,1},{2,2},
  151:                                                {3,1},{3,2},{4,1},{4,2}] >>),
  152:     [2,3,3,4,4,5,5,6] =
  153: 	[(X+Y) || <<X:3>> <= <<1:3,2:3,3:3,4:3>>, <<Y:3>> <= <<1:3,2:3>>],
  154:     [2,3,3,4,4,5,5,6] =
  155: 	[(X+Y) || <<X:3>> <= <<1:3,2:3,3:3,4:3>>, {_,Y} <- [{a,1},{b,2}]],
  156: 
  157:     %% OTP-16899: Nested binary comprehensions would fail to load.
  158:     <<0,1,0,2,0,3,99>> = mixed_nested([1,2,3]),
  159: 
  160:     <<1>> = cs_default(<< <<X>> || L <- [[1]], X <- L >>),
  161: 
  162:     %% The compiler would crash in v3_kernel.
  163:     <<42:32,75:32,253:32,(42 bsl 8 bor 75):32>> =
  164:         cs_default(mixed_size(id([8,16]), <<42,75,253>>)),
  165: 
  166:     silly_lc_bc(5),
  167: 
  168:     gen_data(0),
  169:     gen_data(256),
  170:     gen_data(512),
  171: 
  172:     <<1,2,3>> = cs_default(match_context_1(<<1,2,3>>)),
  173:     <<4,5,6>> = cs_default(match_context_2(<<4,5,6>>)),
  174: 
  175:     <<255>> = over_complex_generator(),
  176:     {'EXIT',_} = catch float_segment_size(),
  177: 
  178:     <<>> = inconsistent_types_1([]),
  179:     {'EXIT',{{bad_generator,42},_}} = catch inconsistent_types_1(42),
  180:     Self = self(),
  181:     {'EXIT',{{bad_generator,Self},_}} = catch inconsistent_types_1(Self),
  182: 
  183:     {'EXIT',{{bad_filter,<<>>},_}} = catch inconsistent_types_2(),
  184: 
  185:     %% Cover some code in beam_ssa_pre_codegen.
  186:     [] = fun(A) ->
  187:                  [] = [ok || <<A:A, _:(A bsr 1)>> <= A]
  188:          end(id(<<>>)),
  189: 
  190:     cs_end().
  191: 
  192: 
  193: mixed_nested(L) ->
  194:     << << << << E:16 >> || E <- L >> || true >>/binary, 99:(id(8))>>.
  195: 
  196: mixed_size(List, Bin) ->
  197:     << <<X:32>> || Size <- List, <<X:Size>> <= Bin >>.
  198: 
  199: silly_lc_bc(N) when N > 0 ->
  200:     Bin = iolist_to_binary(silly_lc(N)),
  201:     Bin = cs(silly_bc(N)),
  202:     Size = byte_size(Bin),
  203:     Size = 5 bsl N,
  204:     silly_lc_bc(N - 1);
  205: silly_lc_bc(_) -> ok.
  206: 
  207: silly_bc(0) ->
  208:     <<0, 1, 2, 3, 4>>;
  209: silly_bc(N) ->
  210:     << <<X, X>> || <<X>> <= silly_bc(N - 1) >>.
  211: 
  212: silly_lc(0) ->
  213:     [0, 1, 2, 3, 4];
  214: silly_lc(N) ->
  215:     [[X, X] || X <- silly_lc(N - 1)].
  216: 
  217: gen_data(Size) ->
  218:     Data = cs(<< <<C>> || C <- lists:seq(0, Size-1) >>),
  219:     Data = << <<C>> || _ <- lists:seq(1, Size div 256),
  220:                        C <- lists:seq(0, 255) >>.
  221: 
  222: match_context_1(<<B/binary>>) ->
  223:     << <<V>> || <<V>> <= B >>.
  224: 
  225: match_context_2(<<B/binary>>) ->
  226:     do_match_context_2(B).
  227: 
  228: do_match_context_2(B) ->
  229:     << <<V>> || <<V>> <= B >>.
  230: 
  231: %% Would crash beam_ssa_bc_size when the no_copt option was given.
  232: over_complex_generator() ->
  233:     <<
  234:       <<255>> ||
  235:         <<0:2>> <= <<0:2>>,
  236:         <<_:8>> <=
  237:             case true of
  238:                 true ->
  239:                     <<8>>;
  240:                 [6.6 | bad_tail] ->
  241:                     ok;
  242:                 [3 | 4] ->
  243:                     error
  244:             end
  245:     >>.
  246: 
  247: float_segment_size() ->
  248:     try
  249:         V = 0.79
  250:     of
  251:         _ ->
  252:             %% Would crash beam_ssa_bc_size when trying to
  253:             %% interpret V * U = 0.79 * 8 as a size.
  254:             <<
  255:               0 || <<5.9:V/unit:8-float>> <= 42
  256:             >>
  257:     catch
  258:         _:_ ->
  259:             error
  260:     end.
  261: 
  262: %% GH-6468. Would crash in beam_ssa_bc_size:update_successors/3.
  263: inconsistent_types_1(X) ->
  264:     <<
  265:       X || _ <- X,
  266:            case is_pid(X) of
  267:                Y ->
  268:                    (#{
  269:                         ((not Y) andalso
  270:                          <<Y:(Y andalso X)>>) := Y
  271:                      } = X);
  272:                _ ->
  273:                    false
  274:            end
  275:     >>.
  276: 
  277: %% GH-6468. Same type of crash.
  278: inconsistent_types_2() ->
  279:     <<
  280:       0 || case id([]) of
  281:                Y ->
  282:                    <<
  283:                      Y ||
  284:                        _ <- Y,
  285:                        (not ((false = Y) = (Y /= []))), (_ = Y)
  286:                    >>
  287:            end
  288:     >>.
  289: 
  290: filters(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  291:     cs_init(),
  292:     <<"BDF">> =
  293: 	cs_default(<< <<(X-32)>> ||
  294: 		       <<X:7>> <= <<$a:7,$b:7,$c:7,$d:7,$e:7,$f:7,$g:7>>,
  295: 		       X rem 2 == 0>>),
  296:     <<"abc">> = cs_default(<< <<(X+32)>> ||
  297: 			       X <- "ABCDEFG",
  298: 			       is_less_than(X, $D)>>),
  299:     <<"efg">> = cs_default(<< <<(X+32)>> ||
  300: 			       X <- "ABCDEFG",
  301: 			       not is_less_than(X, $E)>>),
  302:     <<"b">> = cs_default(<< <<(X+32)>> ||
  303: 			     X <- "ABCDEFG",
  304: 			     is_less_than(X, $D),
  305: 			     X rem 2 == 0>>),
  306:     <<"eg">> = cs_default(<< <<(X+32)>> ||
  307: 			      X <- "ABCDEFG",
  308: 			      not is_less_than(X, $E),
  309: 			      X rem 2 == 1>>),
  310:     <<1,3>> = cs_default(<< <<(length(L))>> ||
  311:                              L <- [[],[a],[],[x,y,z]],
  312:                              case L of
  313:                                  [] -> false;
  314:                                  [_|_] -> true
  315:                              end >>),
  316:     <<77,42>> = cs_default(<< <<B>> || <<B>> <- [<<77>>,<<1,2>>,<<42>>] >>),
  317: 
  318:     %% Filtering by a non-matching pattern.
  319:     <<"abd">> = cs_default(<< <<X:8>> ||
  320: 			       <<0:1,X:7>> <= <<$a:8,$b:8,1:1,$c:7,$d:8,
  321: 						1:1,$e:7,0:4>> >>),
  322: 
  323:     <<42,42>> = cs_default(<< <<42:8>> || 42 <- [1,2,3,42,43,42] >>),
  324:     cs_end().
  325: 
  326: is_less_than(X, C) when X < C -> true;
  327: is_less_than(_, _) -> false.
  328: 
  329: trim_coverage(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  330:     <<0,0,0,2,0,0,5,48,0,11,219,174,0,0,0,0>> = coverage_materialiv(a, b, {1328,777134}),
  331:     <<67,40,0,0,66,152,0,0,69,66,64,0>> = coverage_trimmer([42,19,777]),
  332:     <<0,0,2,43,0,0,3,9,0,0,0,3,64,8,0,0,0,0,0,0,
  333: 	   64,68,0,0,0,0,0,0,192,171,198,0,0,0,0,0>> = 
  334: 	coverage_lightfv(555, 777, {3.0,40.0,-3555.0}),
  335:     <<"abcabc">> = coverage_strange(0, <<"abc">>),
  336:     ok.
  337: 
  338: coverage_materialiv(A, B, Params) ->
  339:     A = id(A),
  340:     B = id(B),
  341:     <<(tuple_size(Params)):32,
  342:      (<< <<C:32>> || C <- tuple_to_list(Params)>>)/binary,
  343:      0:(((1+tuple_size(Params)) rem 2)*32)>>.
  344: 
  345: coverage_lightfv(Light, Pname, Params) ->
  346:     id(<<Light:32,Pname:32,(size(Params)):32,
  347: 	(<< <<C:64/float>> || C <- tuple_to_list(Params)>>)/binary,
  348: 	0:(((1+size(Params)) rem 2)*32)>>).
  349: 
  350: coverage_trimmer(Params) ->
  351:     X = id(0),
  352:     Y = id(1),
  353:     id({X,Y}),
  354:     << <<(begin {A,B,D} = id({C,C,C}), id(0),
  355: 		coverage_summer(A, B, C, D) end):32/float>> ||
  356: 	C <- Params >>.
  357: 
  358: coverage_summer(A, B, C, D) -> A+B+C+D.
  359: 
  360: coverage_strange(V, Bin) ->
  361:     <<
  362:       << <<X>> || <<X/utf8>> <= Bin >>/bits,
  363:       << <<Y>> || <<Y>> <= Bin>>:
  364:       case V of
  365:           V ->
  366:               3;
  367:           0 ->
  368:               receive
  369:                   whatever ->
  370:                       1
  371:               end
  372:       end/bytes>>.
  373: 
  374: nomatch(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  375:     Bin = id(<<1,2,3,4,5>>),
  376:     <<>> = << <<X:8>> || X = {_,_} = [_|_] <- [1,2,3] >>,
  377:     [] = [X || <<X:all/binary>> <= Bin],
  378:     [] = [X || <<X:bad/binary>> <= Bin],
  379:     <<>> = << <<X:32>> || <<X:all/binary>> <= Bin >>,
  380:     <<>> = << <<X:32>> || <<X:bad/binary>> <= Bin >>,
  381: 
  382:     <<>> = << <<"a">> || <<_:1/float>> <= Bin>>,
  383: 
  384:     NaN = <<(-1):32>>,
  385:     <<>> = << <<"a">> || <<_:32/float>> <= NaN >>,
  386: 
  387:     <<1:32,2:32,3:32>> = nomatch_1(<<1,2,3>>, 8),
  388:     <<>> = nomatch_1(<<1,2,3>>, bad),
  389: 
  390:     <<>> = << <<>> || <<_:8>> <= <<>> >>,
  391: 
  392:     %% GH-7494. Qualifiers should be evaluated from left to right. The
  393:     %% second (failing) generator should never be evaluated because the
  394:     %% first generator is an empty list.
  395:     <<>> = id(<< <<C:8>> || C <- [], _ <- ok >>),
  396:     <<>> = id(<<0 || _ <- [], _ <- ok, false>>),
  397: 
  398:     {'EXIT',{{bad_generator,false},_}} = catch << [] || <<0:0>> <= false >>,
  399: 
  400:     ok.
  401: 
  402: nomatch_1(Bin, Size) ->
  403:     << <<X:32>> || <<X:Size>> <= Bin >>.
  404: 
  405: sizes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  406:     cs_init(),
  407:     Fun0 = fun(List) ->
  408: 		   cs(<< <<E:8>> || E <- List >>)
  409: 	   end,
  410:     <<>> = Fun0([]),
  411:     <<1>> = Fun0([1]),
  412:     <<1,2>> = Fun0([1,2]),
  413:     <<1,2,3>> = Fun0([1,2,3]),
  414: 
  415:     Fun1 = fun(List) ->
  416: 		   cs(<< <<E:16>> || E <- List >>)
  417: 	   end,
  418:     <<>> = Fun1([]),
  419:     <<1:16>> = Fun1([1]),
  420:     <<1:16,2:16>> = Fun1([1,2]),
  421:     <<1:16,2:16,3:16>> = Fun1([1,2,3]),
  422: 
  423:     Fun2 = fun(List) ->
  424: 		   cs(<< <<E:4>> || E <- List >>)
  425: 	   end,
  426:     <<>> = Fun2([]),
  427:     <<1:4>> = Fun2([1]),
  428:     <<1:4,13:4>> = Fun2([1,13]),
  429:     <<1:4,13:4,7:4>> = Fun2([1,13,7]),
  430:     <<0:1000/unit:8>> = Fun2(lists:duplicate(2000, 0)),
  431: 
  432:     Fun3 = fun(List) ->
  433: 		   cs(<< <<E:3>> || E <- List >>)
  434: 	   end,
  435:     <<>> = Fun3([]),
  436:     <<40,177,29:5>> = Fun3([1,2,1,3,0,7,5]),
  437:     <<0:512/unit:3>> = Fun3(lists:duplicate(512, 0)),
  438: 
  439:     Fun4 = fun(List, Size) ->
  440: 		   cs(<< <<E:Size>> || E <- List >>)
  441: 	   end,
  442:     <<>> = Fun4([], 8),
  443:     <<42:6>> = Fun4([42], 6),
  444:     <<42:16>> = Fun4([42], 16),
  445: 
  446:     Fun5 = fun(List, Sz1, Sz2, Sz3) ->
  447: 		   cs(<< <<E:Sz1,(E+1):Sz2/unit:8,(E+2):Sz3/unit:8>> || E <- List >>)
  448: 	   end,
  449:     <<>> = Fun5([], 1, 1, 1),
  450:     <<7:3,8:40,9:56>> = Fun5([7], 3, 5, 7),
  451: 
  452:     Fun5a = fun(List, Sz1, Sz2, Sz3) ->
  453:                     cs(<< <<"abc",E:Sz1,(E+1):Sz2/unit:8,"qqq",(E+2):Sz3/unit:8,"xyz">> ||
  454:                           E <- List >>)
  455: 	   end,
  456:     <<>> = Fun5a([], 1, 1, 1),
  457:     <<"abc",7:3,8:40,"qqq",9:56,"xyz">> = Fun5a([7], 3, 5, 7),
  458: 
  459:     Fun6 = fun(List, Size) ->
  460: 		   cs(<< <<E:8,(E+1):Size>> || E <- List >>)
  461: 	   end,
  462:     <<>> = Fun6([], 42),
  463:     <<42,43:20>> = Fun6([42], 20),
  464: 
  465:     Fun7 = fun(B) ->
  466:                    cs_default(<< <<C/utf8>> || C <- B >>)
  467:             end,
  468:     <<"Foundation"/utf8>> = Fun7("Foundation"),
  469:     <<"Основание"/utf8>> = Fun7("Основание"),
  470: 
  471:     %% Binary generators.
  472: 
  473:     Fun10 = fun(Bin) ->
  474: 		    cs(<< <<E:16>> || <<E:8>> <= id(Bin) >>)
  475:             end,
  476:     <<>> = Fun10(<<>>),
  477:     <<1:16>> = Fun10(<<1>>),
  478:     <<1:16,2:16>> = Fun10(<<1,2>>),
  479: 
  480:     Fun11 = fun(Bin) ->
  481: 		    cs(<< <<E:8>> || <<E:16>> <= id(Bin) >>)
  482:             end,
  483:     <<>> = Fun11(<<>>),
  484:     <<1>> = Fun11(<<1:16>>),
  485:     <<1,2>> = Fun11(<<1:16,2:16>>),
  486:     <<1,2>> = Fun11(<<1:16,2:16,0:1>>),
  487:     <<1,2>> = Fun11(<<1:16,2:16,0:7>>),
  488:     <<1,2>> = Fun11(<<1:16,2:16,42:8>>),
  489:     <<1,2>> = Fun11(<<1:16,2:16,42:9>>),
  490:     <<1,2>> = Fun11(<<1:16,2:16,255:15>>),
  491: 
  492:     Fun12 = fun(Bin, Sz1, Sz2) ->
  493: 		    cs(<< <<E:Sz1>> || <<E:Sz2>> <= id(Bin) >>)
  494: 	    end,
  495:     <<>> = Fun12(<<>>, 1, 1),
  496:     Binary = list_to_binary(lists:seq(0, 255)),
  497:     Binary = Fun12(Binary, 1, 1),
  498:     Binary = Fun12(Binary, 4, 4),
  499:     Binary = Fun12(Binary, 8, 8),
  500:     <<17:9,19:9>> = Fun12(<<17:6,19:6>>, 9, 6),
  501: 
  502:     Fun13 = fun(Sz) ->
  503: 		    cs(<< <<C:8>> || <<C:4>> <= <<1:4,2:4,3:4,0:Sz>> >>)
  504:    	    end,
  505:     <<1,2,3>> = Fun13(0),
  506:     <<1,2,3,0>> = Fun13(4),
  507:     <<1,2,3,0>> = Fun13(5),
  508:     <<1,2,3,0>> = Fun13(6),
  509:     <<1,2,3,0>> = Fun13(7),
  510:     <<1,2,3,0,0>> = Fun13(8),
  511: 
  512:     <<0:3>> = cs_default(<< <<0:S>> || S <- [0,1,2] >>),
  513:     <<0:3>> = cs_default(<< <<0:S>> || <<S>> <= <<0,1,2>> >>),
  514: 
  515:     Fun14 = fun(L, B) ->
  516:                     cs_default(<< <<X:32>> || Size <- L, <<X:Size>> <= B >>)
  517:             end,
  518:     <<$a:32,$b:32,$c:32,($a bsl 8 bor $b):32>> = Fun14([8,16], <<"abc">>),
  519:     <<$a:32,$b:32,$c:32>> = Fun14([8,bad], <<"abc">>),
  520: 
  521:     Fun15 = fun(B) ->
  522:                     cs_default(<< <<C/utf8>> || << C:32 >> <= id(B) >>)
  523:             end,
  524:     <<"Foundation"/utf8>> = Fun15(<<"Foundation"/utf32>>),
  525:     <<"Основание"/utf8>> = Fun15(<<"Основание"/utf32>>),
  526: 
  527:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch << <<C:4>> || <<C:8>> <= {1,2,3} >>),
  528: 
  529:     cs_end(),
  530:     ok.
  531: 
  532: -define(BAD(E),   {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch << (E) || _ <- [1,2,3] >>)).
  533: -define(BAD_V(E), {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch << (E) || I <- [1,2,3] >>)).
  534: 
  535: general_expressions(_) ->
  536:     cs_init(),
  537: 
  538:     <<1,2,3>> = cs(<< begin <<1,2,3>> end || _ <- [1] >>),
  539:     <<"abc">> = cs(<< begin <<"abc">> end || _ <- [1] >>),
  540:     <<1,2,3>> = cs_default(<< begin
  541:                                   I = <<(I0+1)>>,
  542:                                   id(I)
  543:                               end || <<I0>> <= <<0,1,2>> >>),
  544:     <<1,2,3>> = cs_default(<< I || I <- [<<1,2>>,<<3>>] >>),
  545:     <<1,2,3>> = cs_default(<< (id(<<I>>)) || I <- [1,2,3] >>),
  546:     <<2,4>> = cs_default(<< case I rem 2 of
  547:                                 0 -> <<I>>;
  548:                                 1 -> <<>>
  549:                             end || I <- [1,2,3,4,5] >>),
  550:     <<2,3,4,5,6,7>> = cs_default(<< << (id(<<J>>)) || J <- [2*I,2*I+1] >> ||
  551:                                      I <- [1,2,3] >>),
  552:     <<1,2,2,3,4,4>> = cs_default(<< if
  553:                                         I rem 2 =:= 0 -> <<I,I>>;
  554:                                         true -> <<I>>
  555:                                     end || I <- [1,2,3,4] >>),
  556:     self() ! <<42>>,
  557:     <<42>> = cs_default(<< receive B -> B end || _ <- [1] >>),
  558:     <<10,5,3>> = cs_default(<< try
  559:                                    <<(10 div I)>>
  560:                                catch _:_ ->
  561:                                        <<>>
  562:                                end || I <- [0,1,2,3] >>),
  563: 
  564:     <<3:4,16#A:4,7:4>> = cs(hstring_to_bitstring("3A7")),
  565:     <<0:3,1:3,2:3,3:3,4:3,5:3,6:3,7:3>> = cs(encode_chars_compact_map("ABCDEFGH", id(3), id({$A,8}))),
  566: 
  567:     cs_end(),
  568: 
  569:     %% Failing expressions.
  570:     ?BAD(bad_atom),
  571:     ?BAD(42),
  572:     ?BAD(42.0),
  573:     ?BAD_V({ok,I}),
  574:     ?BAD_V([I]),
  575:     ?BAD_V(fun() -> I end),
  576: 
  577:     ok.
  578: 
  579: hstring_to_bitstring(L) ->
  580:     << <<(hex_to_int(D)):4>> || D <- L >>.
  581: 
  582: hex_to_int(D) when $0 =< D, D =< $9 -> D - $0;
  583: hex_to_int(D) when $A =< D, D =< $F -> D - ($A - 10).
  584: 
  585: encode_chars_compact_map(Val, NumBits, {Lb,Limit}) ->
  586:     << <<(enc_char_cm(C, Lb, Limit)):NumBits>> || C <- Val >>.
  587: 
  588: enc_char_cm(C0, Lb, Limit) ->
  589:     C = C0 - Lb,
  590:     if
  591: 	0 =< C, C < Limit ->
  592: 	    C;
  593: 	true ->
  594:             error(illegal)
  595:     end.
  596: 
  597: -undef(BAD).
  598: 
  599: no_generator(_Config) ->
  600:     [<<"abc">>] = [<<(id(<<"abc">>)) || true >>],
  601:     {<<>>} = {<<(id(<<"abc">>)) || false >>},
  602: 
  603:     %% Would crash the compiler when compiled with +no_type_opt.
  604:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch << (catch "\001") || true >>),
  605: 
  606:     ok.
  607: 
  608: zero_pattern(Config) ->
  609:     case is_atom(Config) of
  610:         true ->
  611:             %% Patterns that match zero bits loops forever, so we must
  612:             %% be careful not to execute them.
  613:             _ = << <<>> || <<>> <= <<>> >>,
  614:             _ = << <<42>> || <<>> <= <<42>> >>,
  615:             _ = <<
  616:                   <<>> ||
  617:                     <<>> <= << >>,
  618:                     <<3:back>> <= << >>
  619:                 >>,
  620:             _ = <<
  621:                   <<>> ||
  622:                     <<>> <= <<>>,
  623:                     <<>> <- << <<>> || area >>
  624:                 >>;
  625:         false ->
  626:             ok
  627:     end.
  628: 
  629: multiple_segments(_Config) ->
  630:     cs_init(),
  631: 
  632:     [1,2] = matched_out_size(<<4, 1:4, 4, 2:4>>),
  633:     [42] = matched_out_size(<<16, 42:16, 72>>),
  634: 
  635:     [] = do_multiple_segments_1(<<>>),
  636:     [] = do_multiple_segments_1(<<1>>),
  637:     [] = do_multiple_segments_1(<<1,2>>),
  638:     [] = do_multiple_segments_1(<<1,2,3>>),
  639:     [1,4] = do_multiple_segments_1(<<99,0,1,1,2,3,4,4>>),
  640: 
  641:     [] = do_multiple_segments_2(<<1,2>>),
  642:     [6] = do_multiple_segments_2(<<1,2,3>>),
  643:     [6,15] = do_multiple_segments_2(<<1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8>>),
  644: 
  645:     cs_end(),
  646:     ok.
  647: 
  648: matched_out_size(Gen) ->
  649:     Bin = cs_default(<< <<X>> || <<S,X:S>> <= Gen >>),
  650:     List = [X || <<S,X:S>> <= Gen],
  651:     Bin = list_to_binary(List),
  652:     List.
  653: 
  654: do_multiple_segments_1(Gen) ->
  655:     Bin = cs_default(<< <<V>> || <<V,V>> <= Gen >>),
  656:     List = [V || <<V,V>> <= Gen],
  657:     Bin = list_to_binary(List),
  658:     List.
  659: 
  660: do_multiple_segments_2(Gen) ->
  661:     Bin = cs(<< <<(A+B+C)>> || <<A,B,C>> <= Gen >>),
  662:     List = [A+B+C || <<A,B,C>> <= Gen],
  663:     Bin = list_to_binary(List),
  664:     List.
  665: 
  666: grab_bag(_Config) ->
  667:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = catch grab_bag_gh_6553(<<>>),
  668:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = catch grab_bag_gh_6553(a),
  669:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,<<>>},_}} = catch grab_bag_gh_6553(<<42>>),
  670: 
  671:     %% Cover a line v3_kernel:get_line/1.
  672:     _ = catch << ok || <<>> <= ok, ok >>,
  673: 
  674:     ok.
  675: 
  676: grab_bag_gh_6553(<<X>>) ->
  677:     %% Would crash in beam_ssa_pre_codegen.
  678:     <<X, ((<<_:0>> = <<_>>) = <<>>)>>.
  679: 
  680: cs_init() ->
  681:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  682:     ok.
  683: 
  684: cs_end() ->
  685:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false),
  686:     ok.
  687: 
  688: %% Verify that the allocated size is exact (rounded up to the nearest byte).
  689: cs(Bin) ->
  690:     case ?MODULE of
  691:         bs_bincomp_no_opt_SUITE ->
  692:             ok;
  693:         bs_bincomp_no_ssa_opt_SUITE ->
  694:             ok;
  695:         bs_bincomp_no_copt_SUITE ->
  696:             ok;
  697:         bs_bincomp_no_copt_ssa_SUITE ->
  698:             ok;
  699:         bs_bincomp_post_opt_SUITE ->
  700:             ok;
  701:         _ ->
  702:             ByteSize = byte_size(Bin),
  703:             {refc_binary,ByteSize,{binary,ByteSize},_} =
  704:                 erts_debug:get_internal_state({binary_info,Bin})
  705:     end,
  706:     Bin.
  707: 
  708: %% Verify that the allocated size of the binary is the default size.
  709: cs_default(Bin) ->
  710:     ByteSize = byte_size(Bin),
  711:     {refc_binary,ByteSize,{binary,256},_} = 
  712: 	erts_debug:get_internal_state({binary_info,Bin}),
  713:     Bin.
  714: 
  715: id(I) -> I.
